notes.note: OS X: nsCocoaWindow::ConstrainPosition uses wrong screen in multi-display setup
Full screen support for Mac OS X Lion implemented
The Awesome Bar now auto-completes typed URLs
Focus rings keep growing when repeatedly tabbing through elements
GIF animation can gets stuck when src and image size are changed
CSS :hover regression when an element's class name is set by Javascript
Improved site identity manager, to prevent spoofing of an SSL connection with favicons
New API to prevent your display from sleeping
New text-transform and font-variant CSS improvements for Turkic languages and Greek

If you try to start Firefox using a locked profile, it will crash (see [573369][1])


  [1]: http://bugzilla.mozilla.org/573369

system_requirements:
Windows

Operating Systems
  • Windows XP SP2
  • Windows Server 2003
  • Windows Vista
  • Windows 7

Please note that while the 32-bit and 64-bit versions of Windows Vista and Windows 7 can be used to run Firefox 14, only 32-bit builds of Firefox 14 are supported at this time.

Recommended Hardware
  • Pentium 4 or newer processor that supports SSE2
  • 512MB of RAM
  • 200MB of hard drive space

Mac

Operating Systems
  • Mac OS X 10.5
  • Mac OS X 10.6
  • Mac OS X 10.7
Recommended Hardware
  • Macintosh computer with an Intel x86 processor
  • 512 MB of RAM
  • 200 MB hard drive space

Linux

Software Requirements

Please note that Linux distributors may provide packages for your distribution which have different requirements.

  • Firefox will not run at all without the following libraries or packages:
    • GTK+ 2.10 or higher
    • GLib 2.12 or higher
    • Pango 1.14 or higher
    • X.Org 1.0 or higher (1.7 or higher is recommended)
    • libstdc++ 4.3 or higher
  • For optimal functionality, we recommend the following libraries or packages:
    • NetworkManager 0.7 or higher
    • DBus 1.0 or higher
    • HAL 0.5.8 or higher
    • GNOME 2.16 or higher
title: Firefox 14.0beta Beta
